title: Local enhancement of the mean-field approximation for bosons
authors: Marius Lemm, Simone Rademacher, Jingxuan Zhang
abstract:
We study the quantum many-body dynamics of a Bose-Einstein condensate (BEC)
on the lattice in the mean-field regime. We derive a local enhancement of the
mean-field approximation: At positive distance $\rho>0$ from the initial BEC,
the mean-field approximation error at time $t\leq \rho/v$ is bounded as
$\rho^{-n}$, for arbitrarily large $n\geq 1$. This is a consequence of new
ballistic propagation bounds on the fluctuations around the condensate. To
prove this, we develop a variant of the ASTLO (adiabatic spacetime localization
observable) method for the particle non-conserving generator of the fluctuation
dynamics around Hartree states.
